text:
My husband and I are about to leave here after staying a week and have loved every minute. Initially it felt a little remote but we soon discovered there was a lot to do on site and around the area. Having said that, we haven't wanted to go out much since it's so peaceful and restful and just what we needed to rest and reset.

The staff are lovely and very keen to share the local culture with you if you ask questions and show an interest.

The restaurant has a great selection of food and is well priced. There's also plenty of eateries a short walk along the beach or else a short drive away.

The day spa is also fabulous, we went off site to try somewhere else and wished we hadn't. Whilst more expensive than outside the villas, it's worth the spend.

My husband surfs and has loved waking up right outside a great surf break. It's not crowded and the vibe is friendly. I like that I can see him and wave him in when when I want to go out. :)

We have really enjoyed our stay here and decided to return annually. We checked out some neighbouring places to stay but for us as a couple - Komaneka at Keramas fits the bill perfectly.
title: Restful and peaceful

text: We stayed for 4 nights in Aug and had a super time. The hotel is only one year old, so everything is new with very little wear and tear. The 2 bedroom villas are very spacious and beautifully designed. Our villa pool overlooked the rice fields which looked majestic in the morning and calm and tranquil at night. Hotel pool is huge and we had to ourselves most days. The black volcanic sand beach sparkles in the sun and is soft on foot. The beach is very rustic and not yet developed which is a great contrast to Nusa Dua. Most of the time we had the gym to ourselves. The overall setting is stunning combining beach with rice padi fields and mountains in background. Would highly recommend
title: Amazing

text:
The most beautiful resort we have been to! Well maintained garden, stunning 40m pool with sunbeds both at the pool as well as at the beachfront. 

The dining area is a widespread, roofed open area in typical Balinese style, with movable glasswalls to protect you from wind or rain. The view you get from here is priceless- overlooking the ocean beach and the large pool. We thoroughly enjoyed our delicious multi-course breakfasts that was one of 4 varying menus at the restaurant. It was also possible to eat in our villa. The kitchen staff was always willing to accommodate any special requests we had. The main chef also came personally to talk with us and have us try her yummy special vegan cakes and breads. 

The main attraction of the resort itself was our beachfront villa with its private pool! Private is really private here, no one can look inside your small paradise, while your view over the infinity edge pool towards the ocean is spectacular! The L-shaped pool is nice and refresing, not too cold, not too hot, and has a very practical flat entrance where our 2 year old daughter could safely splash around- she absolutely loved it! Other features included an open roofed seating area, sunbeds with an umbrella and a beautiful gazebo at the other end of the pool  Throughout the day there was always some area of shade on the pool if you wanted to stay out of the sun. The room itself has glass walls with curtains on three sides and overlooks your whole space. In addition there is a spacious bathroom with two sinks, plenty of space for luggage, separate toilet, nice bathtub and inside and outside showers! What else could one wish for.

Most important however is the warmth of the entire staff, who makes you feel very special and at home throughout your stay! We were touched by the kindness and care of everyone we met, especially towards our daughter, who felt very comfortable with all of them.

Kande, the manager, is personally interested in your ultimate well being and you can approach him with any request. I was personally interested in the construction process of the upcoming buildings, as only the front row of villas were completed. So Kande was so nice and gave us a personal tour through the whole resort including the construction site, and we were able to see the unbelieavable views from the villas that are being completed in an higher area of the property. Important to note is that the construction process is not at all disturbing to the guests.

On a day trip to Ubud we stopped by the Komaneka resort at Rasa Sayang to freshen up. We were very touched by the warm welcome by the staff who made us feel like we were returning home. The same warmth and hospitality we experienced at Keramas we felt here as well.
   
As the first returning guests at the resort after just 3 months and spending 2 weeks at the resort after our previous 1 week stay, we felt very special to meet the owners personally, a very warm Balinese family.

In summary we spent the nicest two holidays we have ever had and will hopefully be triple-returning guests soon! Thank you so much.
title: Another wonderful stay in paradise!

As I sit in the private pool, beside my villa, I reflect on the time that we have spent here! The staff members are deliciously sweet, and nothing is too much trouble. In fact, no matter what you request, their response is always “My pleasure.” 

The main pool is large! Equipped with a huge inflatable unicorn. My children have loved that. The pool, gym,  restaurant and spa are centrally located. And just steps from the black sand beach. The only downsides are 1) the beach is quite dirty. 2) The beach is meant for surfing, rather than swimming, but I knew that ahead of time. And 3) There are a few dogs, who appear to be living on the hotel grounds. They bark a lot and scared my daughters yesterday. They were barking at us. The main pool towel attendant quieted them down.

The food is good! Room service is great! I had two massages, which I enjoyed very much! 

We end our day at sunset, because the bats come out and they freak me out! 

Overall, great place. It’s peaceful and beautiful.

text:
Together with our teenager daughter, we stayed at this wonderful hotel for 11 nights for our summer holiday this year. We have been travelling many places around the world for summer holidays, and this one was our best holiday ever! 
What a surprise – this is the paradise hotel!  Everything is just perfect: perfect location, perfect villa style, perfect interior design, perfect facilities quality, perfect food, and most importantly perfect staff! From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we felt very welcomed by the super professional and friendly staff as well as a hand-writing welcome letter from the hotel manager and his staff which is unique nowadays. All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful. They knew us by names, which made us feel as their family members. Food in the hotel was excellent and the service we got was on top level. We had all our meals in the hotel, enjoying the food combination of western and local cuisine. In a couple of evenings, our daughter asked for Spaghetti Bolognese (her favorite dish) which is not on the menu, the kitchen even made it for her – thanks a lot – we truly appreciate! 
A special thanks to the hotel manager Kande – friendly and caring with great sense of humor. He gave us his personal phone number in case we need any help when we drove around in Bali. On the day of check-out, Kande was planning to say goodbye to us in person. Due to the traffic however, he could not reach the hotel. He let his front desk staff to pass his good wishes to us. Also, big thanks to Ari for the detailed introduction tour as well as arranging the snorkeling tour for us. Eka, Rudi and Dekyun: thanks a lot for the top level service with your natural beautiful smile! 
This was our first visit, and it is absolutely not the last one – we will be back! We will recommend this place to anyone who would like to explore Bali to have an experience of being in the paradise!

text:
We’ve stayed 15 nights in this amazing place. It was so much more than just a hotel - for a fortnight, it was our lush home in Bali. We simply can’t praise it enough - they got everything right. 

First, the villa was incredibly comfortable and spacious. We had direct sea views and went to sleep and woke up every day with the sound of the waves splashing against the shore. We were so impressed with the attention to details, a great blend of comfort and design, wood, marble and glass. We spent a lot of time in the villa, enjoying every minute. We had a private pool, with sun beds plus a few shady areas where we could lounge about, read, drink and eat.

Keramas is a beautiful and wild beach. The black sand makes it even more special. We took long walks along the beach. The hotel’s swimming pool near the beach is huge (40m) and a pleasure to swim in. We also spend time lounging in the little sea facing beach lounge huts near the pool.

Breakfast is very special, the selection of main courses changes every day, and everything is prepared locally. Fresh local fruit juices, beautiful fresh breads, great mix of local ingredients, tasty local dishes and healthy western dishes. The Timur Kitchen restaurant serves a great dinner, with a wonderful selection of wines. Having dinner and watching the sea was a great end to our day.  

Ubud is about 30-45 minutes away by taxi, and it was very easy to book a car and visit the area. We felt happy to be able to enjoy Keramas and also to have access to short trips in the area.

And finally, we need to mention the people who served us. They were simply wonderful, each of them. They were genuinely welcoming and did everything to make us feel at home. They created a great atmosphere and it was clear they love working there and sharing this with the guests. They knew our names, were very personal and remembered our personal preferences for everything. We feel we really got to know them and they got to know us. We felt like family.   

We will be back and look forward to trying the other Komaneka hotels in Ubud.
title: The best of all worlds

text:
We stayed in Komaneka at Keramas Beach for three nights in total. What can I say; our stay was simply wonderful. We arrived very late at night after a long flight and we were welcomed by the considerate staff who took impeccable care of us throughout our stay. The staff knew us by our names, showed a genuine interest in us and went out of their way to ensure that all of our requests were met with a smile.

We stayed in an Ocean view villa, which is spacious and comfortable with a private infinity pool overlooking the sea. The attention to detail and the care with which the villa is appointed really gives guests a sense of luxury. Every morning we woke up to the calming sight and sounds of the ocean from our bed. As a matter of fact, throughout our entire stay, it was the only sound we heard as the resort is a very tranquil and peaceful place— a perfect getaway for city-dwellers needing a rest, like myself.

The restaurant, Timur Kitchen, serves a changing à la carte breakfast each day which we chose to have in the restaurant itself, overlooking the sea, but can also be served in the villa. Breakfast consisted of a delightful spread of fresh local fruits, excellent breads and patisserie, hot main dishes, fresh juices etc. It was such a soothing way to start the day.

One of the unique features of the hotel is the long winding walkways over rice fields that lead to various areas of the resort, such as the restaurant, Olympic-sized pool, spa and beach area. At night time these are lit up and look nothing short of magical. 

All in all, I have only extremely positive things to say about our stay at Komaneka at Keramas Beach. It truly felt like a moment in paradise.
title: Simply wonderful.

text:
We stayed at Komaneka Keramas for 12 nights, 13 days for our honeymoon. This home by the sea is beautiful, stunning, and well worth every penny. We traveled about 30 hours to get here and were very tired when we arrived. They were extremely welcoming and had everything ready. Getting checked in was a breeze. Every staff member we spoke to from beginning to end was delightful!

I don't think I've ever been to a hotel, or place in general, that looks exactly like the pictures on the actual hotel website. Komaneka at Keramas, in person, looks EXACTLY like the pictures. Our room was beautiful and spotless. The private pool in the room was amazing, not too cold. Every room literally has an ocean view. The walkways over the rice fields and to the rooms are stunning. The bigger hotel pool was also wonderful, like everything else. We had beer at the pool almost every other day :) 
Although there were other people staying there, we often had the big pool to ourselves. Over the 13 days it was very quiet. It was nice to not be in the center of crowds or at a party hotel. 

The food at Timur kitchen was delicious! We ate there for breakfast, lunch, and dinner most days. You can have your meals literally anywhere in the hotel though; on the day beds looking over the beach, in your room, at the pool, wherever. They have many different options for breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner. The drinks were good too, but we're easily satisfied with beer so that's mostly what we had. 

Yes the hotel is still finishing up their other villas, but we rarely heard any construction noises over the waves crashing into the beach. Plus, it's not like they're hammering away in the middle of the night. They only work during the day. They told us they are also building another restaurant and a library. We visited their gift shop and bought a few things to bring back to family members. We came to Bali with no plan except to stay at this hotel. It was very easy to talk to someone at the front desk and arrange an activity or place to go for the day. One staff member helped us plan a trip to Ubud to see a few temples, and gave us other ideas/places to go. 

If it wasn't such a long way from Texas, we would be back sooner than you can say yeehaw. When we do come back, we want to bring our family and friends with us. We recommended (and will continue to recommend) Komaneka at Keramas to everyone who asked about our honeymoon. :)
title: Perfect and Remarkable Honeymoon

text:
After reading the positive reviews here, my husband and I decided to stay here for 4 nights on our first trip to Bali.  We were glad we did!

Having the black sand beach in front and having the rice paddies around the resort was absolutely amazing. Not to mention our clean pool villa with ocean view and the warm staff to help us with everything we need. We enjoyed our breakfasts at the restaurant and the complimentary afternoon tea. 

As Ubud is a must visit place, we decided to go on our 2nd and 3rd day with the free shuttle (private car provided by the hotel to the sister hotels in Ubud) which took about 30 minutes without traffic and maybe 45 minutes with heavy traffic.  We did think Ubud was great but it was to cramped and noisy for our couple to be honest.  Also, the sister hotels seemed to be nice but we were happy with our decision in staying at a more relaxed, newer, and spacious Keramas Beach.

Though we did like almost everything about this place, I do have to say that there were not much food options because there is only one restaurant at the resort.  We were told that an indoor restaurant (currently only one semi-outdoor restaurant) was under construction but they do not know when it will open. So, we went to Ubud for lunches and  dinners at the nearby local restaurant which was pretty good (reasonably priced).

Overall, it made my first stay in Bali great! :)
title: Absolutely amazing

text:
Where to start? We stayed here for three nights in May and went back a week later for three more days, changing our plans entirely to do so, we couldn't stay away!

I will start with entering the property. You will have driven in some pretty hectic traffic before arriving at Komaneka, no matter what direction you will be coming from. Once you turn of the incredibly hectic road, though, and past the gates, you are in an utterly quiet and tranquil rice field, which surrounds and inhabits the grounds of Komaneka. That's the first slice of awesome you are served. The second- and the best- part of Komaneka comes next- the staff.  I confess that I love Balinese people- I think they are the kindest, warmest, most playful people of any country I have ever visited. But the staff at Komaneka take it to another level- their hospitality is impeccable, but nothing stuffy or awkward about it- they retain their playful, affable natures and infuse their effortless hospitality with so much personality.  

This is turning into a rather long posting! But still so much to say about Komaneka. The villas- outstanding. Minimalist glass room facing the ocean with private pool and big covered daybed- the little kitchen area (well, a beautiful credenza with fridge and mini bar and the like) and the eating area and sofa are all on the side which is outdoor but covered. Just incredible space and layout. Amazing huge bathtub, indoor and outdoor shower. AND THAT BED!!! The pillows, the linens, the mattress- I am a bit of a bedding snob, and this met all my criteria. I miss that bed!! We stayed in Villa 103 the first go round, and 104 when we went back the second time. I would recommend either of those.

The food. THE FOOD! I could not get enough of the freshly bakes croissants in the morning with fresh home made strawberry jam. Unreal. My other morning favorite, besides the strong Bali coffee and passionfruit (if you have never had it, ask for it. They have it but it doesn't come with the fruit platter unless you ask), was the breakfast quinoa with soft boiled eggs. The pickle the onions in lime juice and the avocado, cilantro (or coriander) and tomatoes are so fresh!  We both also loved the chicken florentine pasta. I think my only complaint in this department would be that there are not many options in terms of food, and the menu doesn't change much between lunch and dinner, and the same everyday. Since I don't eat pork or red meat, and I don't really like cooked fish, my options were pretty limited, but still delicious. There is a tea from 4-5 with little amuse bouches and tea or coffee.

We did not do any of the spa options. We went on some excursions, but also spent many days just relaxing in the sun in our little pool and ordering room service. We liked to wake up early to see the sunrise, I suggest you do. Sunrise is incredible here. Sunset- we didn't get to see as the clouds rolled in every late afternoon. It seems that the wind picks up around 2 and gets stronger until evening- at least in May, it did for us. Hence we didn't get to see any stars, either.

There were so many amazing people there who made us feel so taken care of, remembered what we did and didn't like, and all went above and beyond to make sure we were smiling and relaxed and had no worries. Asa, who was at reception, went above and beyond to arrange lodging for us at the Komaneka in Ubud, where we stayed one night (Monkey Forest) before moving on. Cande, manager at Komaneka Keramas, called my fiance at the Monkey Forest location to make sure we had everything we needed, and to let us know he already told them of our preferences so they had a special menu waiting for us in our room.

Moul was awesome; and Firti, and Putu- and I am so sad that I didn't write everyone's names down because every single person there was so incredible. I didn't want to leave- mostly them. Luxury bores me pretty quickly, but I can never get enough of beautiful, warm, sincere people. 

The bad- There always is. Currently there are only 9 villas, so we got a super quiet and bespoke experience. We maybe saw 6 people on the last day we were there and said to each other- "Its a good thing we are leaving, it's getting busy around here." 6 people! And we thought that was busy!!! All that was great- here is what is not so great- they are working on the other villas, and there will be a total of 38 or so. I can't imagine that place full of people- my experience was so singular partly because of how few people there were.  Also- not too bad, but keep in mind- mosquitos. Just make sure to spray the provided spray on all your parts, and do not forget to dab on your face, your neck, back of neck and feet and ankles and back of hands. They are relentless. The property is nestled in a rice field- which is standing water- so keep that in mind. 

We saw one family there with small kids- I think you could find a more suitable family spot. The beach is not good for kids- its black lava sand, and it's a surf beach so it isn't safe to go in. There is no guard around the villa pool, and in no way does it feel like a family type of place. What it is is tranquil and minimalist and super sexy- so I am sure other guests would be very happy if you did not bring your children, too. 

This is the longest review I ever wrote! If you made it this far, then thank you and I hope that you stay with my lovely new friends at Komaneka. Tell Cande and Moul and Firti and Asa and the rest of them Ashley and Sage said hello if this helped you do decide to go!
title: Serenity! Like being a well cared for baby. Seriously. They do it all exactly right here.

text:
After spending time in Ubud, we wanted to experience the black vulcano beaches of Bali. We found Keramas beach which is a new resort in an area on the east coast with not many other hotels. This means that is it quiet and perfect for a couple to have some relaxing days. All the villa are not completed, which meant relatively few people and so much peace. We loved that.
Everything is new and the villa we had was amazing with a nice view to the sea, a big room with a big bed, hot tub, indoor and outdoor shower and Apple TV with a lot of movies. Outside it was spacious with a gazebo, sun beds and the most amazing private pool. There is nothing better than waking up with a swim in your own pool. The hotel area is full of beautiful rice fields and the beach is this cool black, vulcano sand beach. 
All in all, it was a great stay and a nice part of our Bali experience. If you choose to stay at the hotel, I can recommend going to the Tukad Cepung Waterfall, it is beautiful.

text:
We just finished our 4 day stay at Komaneka at Keramas beach (second part of our third Bali visit) and believe me if I say that this was the most luxurious and satisfying holiday in Bali period. 
The hotel was brand new (so new in fact that some of the construction is still ongoing) but we didn’t aware of it at all. The villa was beautiful with unobstructed ocean view except some greenery. It was very spacious with a huge comfortable bed, very large bathroom with a big bathtub and separate shower and a walk in closet in between. There’s a garden around and an infinity pool of not inconsiderable size with a gazebo at one side. 

Hotel has a working spa, a 40 m. outdoor swimming pool and a lovely open air restaurant in which you can take your complimentary afternoon tea. The beach is not ideal for swimming but the waves were appreciated by the surfers. The service was exquisite and the staff was very welcoming and helpful in the traditional Balinese way. 

All in all we didn’t want to leave and I can recommend anyone who wants to experience a tropical paradise but doesn’t want to spend a fortune.
title: Amazing hotel at an reasonably affordable price

text:
This property is located adjacent to a beautiful black sand beach. Even the crabs are black! The hotel discourages swimming here becau­se it's a public beach with a strong current. It's great for surfers and there's a surf school nearby. There are no lifeguards at the beach nor at the pool. We walked along the beach and swam in the water. One of us was bitten by something (jellyfish?). She was fine, just had an itchy rash for a few hours.  There were no vendors or anyone to bother us, just a few surfers out on the water. The property is 30 to 40 minutes from shopping and markets. Note: Warong Legong provides free shuttle service from the hotel. And the hotel provides a shuttle to a mini-mart 2x per day. Note: This information wasn't readily provided upon check in.

The architecture of this property is fascinating. There are many stairs and bridges to get between rooms and the main building. Golf carts will only take you so far. Many of the paths are at the level of the coconut palm trees. When I asked the restaurant staff about the coconuts, they said they'd harvest some young coconuts for us to have at our next meal. (They did and they were great!) This hotel started as an art gallery and you can see interesting artwork in the public spaces. The majority of the property is not air conditioned. There is a lovely large pool with daybeds and chaises at no additional charge. The gym (not air-conditioned!) and spa are small but quite nice.  Yoga and afternoon tea are offered at the same time everyday. (Why??) When the weather is nice, yoga is on a small island next to the restaurant, otherwise it's offered in the gallery. We saw what appeared to be a Komodo dragon on the opposite shore; the instructor said not to worry, they eat the snakes!

Six of stayed quite comfortably in a two-bedroom villa with our own pool and beautiful views. The air-conditioned rooms were large and the ensuite bathrooms were very big too! Note that the upstairs bedroom was much larger and had 3 a/c units. Rooms included bottled water, (tap water is not potable), dental kits, robes, slippers, safes, plenty of space for hanging clothes, kettle with tea and a Nespresso machine, refrigerators, fresh fruit, bath salts, bubble bath, liquid soap, conditioner and lotion (no brand was listed). Oddly, we didn't get shampoo until our third day.  Rooms are cleaned daily. 

There is one large outdoor restaurant with view of the beach where all meals are served. Breakfast was included with our room. There was a fee for the floating breakfast for “one” which included 4 entrees! The breakfast included a buffet of fresh fruit and a selection of breads, plus a menu of western and Indonesia dishes served to your table. 

The people working here are all very nice and working very hard.

Now the negatives: The mattress pads on our bed were stained and disgusting. Upon hearing my complaint, the bedding was all changed. When I drew the sheer shades, I noticed they were covered with bugs or parts of bugs. Upon hearing my complaint, the curtains were promptly picked clean. 
The first morning I was awakened by a cacophony of birds, roosters crowing, dogs barking. I did not notice this on rest of our stay. I read in another review that we might notice smoke from a brick factory. We did not, but on a couple of occasions we did smell something burning, it was more like incense. Finally, service in the restaurant, especially at dinner was very slow. One night we had to wait over an hour from ordering to getting our food. The whole place has very dedicated staff, but they lack a sense of urgency or perhaps sufficient staff.
title: Great beach, if you're a surfer!

text:
My husband and I stayed at Komaneka Keramas Beach for 4 nights for our delayed honeymoon and it was absolutely incredible! We have stayed at Komaneka Ubud in the past, but this was our first experience at the Keramas Beach loaction.

We arrived from the sister hotel in Ubud (Komaneka Bisma) via airconditioned transfer that was included in our package. I cannot fault the hotel staff - very friendly and helpful, always with a smile on their face. On arrival, we received a very refreshing welcome drink and a tour of the facilities before being taken to our villa.

Our one bedroom pool villa (#108) was incredible! It was located close to the beach with uninterrupted views out to the ocean, yet still very private. Spacious, clean, comfy bed/pillows, and loved the room service twice a day (morning during breakfast and turndown at night). The large rainfall shower was great also. It was so nice to fall asleep each night to the sound of waves! We spent most of our days relaxing in our villa on the deck chairs soaking up the sun and taking a dip in the pool - it was so easy unwind and enjoy the serenity. I cannot fault the room!

This was our first time staying in the Keramas beach area. It is very quiet and peaceful - exactly what we were looking for! It's a very local area with not many tourists about. A great place to enjoy Bali without the hustle and bustle, so it was a great choice for our honeymoon. It is a popular beach for surfing, so if you enjoy surfing it is a great spot for you! The black beach is very unique and quite pretty (it sparkles more than normal sand!), however was full of debris (wood, rocks, rubbish etc) in some areas so take care when walking along the beach. Sunrise from our villa was absouley magical! We also had some beautiful sunsets.

The resort itself is set on the idyllic Keramas Beach front, whilst also having views of rice patties/jungle. It is a very unique hotel built above ground level adding to the feel of being in an oasis! The main pool is massive and located close to the beach. It was always empty as I imagine most guests were enjoying their pool villas. We enjoyed chilling by the main pool when we checked out and had some time to kill before our shuttle to the airport. There are also very inviting cabanas alongside the pool which are lovely to relax in!

We indulged in some spa treatments during our stay (1 hour massage, facial and 30min back/neck massage) and all were fantastic. Being able to enjoy our treatments whilst listening to the sound of the waves in the ocean made for a very relaxing atmosphere. The staff went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable and relaxed which made the experience even better! Absolutely bliss!

The menu and Timur Kitchen was great and you can see the chef takes care in the preparation of the food. All the food we had was very tasty and good quality for hotel food standards. We did feel like we needed to order 3 meals between us for dinner given the portion sizes (an entree to share and 2 mains). The al a carte breakfast was very yummy, however could do with some more options. After coming from Bisma, we had rotated through everything pretty quickly. The French toast and tomato/spinach scrambled eggs were my tops picks! Given the location, food options are limited. A few times we wandered down the beach to other restaurants for some variety for dinner and lunch (the Breman Brewery is fantastic!). The one thing I would say that would make this hotel even better is if there was a second restaurant that specialised in a specific cuisine. This would provide more variety to guests.

Overall, we had the most relaxing experience at Komaneka Keramas. We love the hospitality Komaneka has provided to us time and time again during our stays with the brand. It is the personal touches (i.e. staff remembering our name) and the level of care that makes the all difference. It has the feel of boutique hotel, with the luxury of having all the amenities and conveniences of a large resort. This is the perfect place to relax and enjoy spending time with your significant other. Thank you again Komaneka for a memorable stay! :)
title: Luxury Private Pool Villa Paradise

text:
I enjoyed my 3-night stay at Komaneka—the villas are beautiful, grounds stunning, and the spa was lovely. We stayed in an Ocean Villa and loved drifting off to sleep each night to the sound of crashing waves. The villa was spacious, had a good-sized pool and housekeeping was excellent (each morning my room was cleaned while I was at breakfast, which I love!) To echo a previous reviewer, it is silly you cannot control the exterior villa lights. I had to call reception each night so they can turn them off from the switchboard. 

The main pool is stunning and was empty throughout my stay. I had a 60-minute massage which was great, if not a tad too vigorous! All the staff we interacted with were charming and super efficient. 

What they do need to improve is the food and beverage. The menu was limited and not particularly appealing. Also, serving sizes were small—I often found myself ordering two meals for dinner. I mainly ordered Indonesian dishes which lacked flavour and spice and became repetitive. Breakfast was fine, but after my third day I was struggling. There isn’t much around the hotel, so you are reliant on their restaurant. 

Overall, I enjoyed my stay but would only return if the food improves.
title: Beautiful resort with some room for improvement

text:
We stayed at Komaneka for 2 nights in September. The rooms are very nice and the sleeping quality was excellent. The location is lovely , surrounded by rice fields and the black sand beach. Staff was excellent with the exception of the female pool attendant and the waitress we had during dinner. Breakfast was really really good.

Room for improvement :

- We had booked 3 rooms and when we arrived around 3:30 one room was still not ready. This is very odd since check in time clearly states 2pm and they didn't seem to be sorry about this.

- It's not possible to switch off the lights in front of the bedroom and the pool at night so we had to call staff to do it manually. Who on earth wants bright lights during the night.

- Dinner at the main restaurant was awful, and i really mean it. Super unfriendly staff, food was some of the worst i have ever eaten in my entire life. There was hardly any red wine left to order from. The wine list was not updated and the few wines they had left were not even on the drink list. We saw other tables facing the same problem. It was hideous all, thank god we had dinner at the'' Komune beach club'' for the second night where everything was absolutely fantastic. 

- There is no turn down service and no one ever refilled any water or coffee capsules. 
When we checked out from the room, there was no buggy service back to the reception and we waited quite a bit to be escorted back to the reception. I mean where is the point , they could have just told us we got to walk and we would have done it ourselves. 

All in all, we had a very pleasant stay.
title: Nice resort with some flaws

text:
My wife and I stayed at Komaneka at Keramas Beach while ditching a sub-par Airbnb, and were we pleasantly surprised at the level of excellence Keramas Beach delivered.

While in Bali for over 6 weeks, 10 locations, this was our #1 stay. A bit of a journey to get here, but without question, worth the drive. From the moment you arrive, you are greeted with warmth and kindness by the entire staff. Check-in was incredibly easy and we were in our villa pool within minutes of dropping our bags.

The southeasterly views of the Indian Ocean with the black sand beaches made for an incredible backdrop to a perfect day. For dinner, we visited Timur Kitchen on site and again were thrilled with the variety, service, and flavor. We ended up returning night and night without getting tired of the menu.

The beds were extremely comfortable, the rooms were clean, and the A/c worked perfectly. If you spend enough time on the island, you generally find that you get one or two of the aforementioned, not all three. At Komaneka at Kermas Beach, you got all three and some.

I cannot recommend this Komaneka enough. If we get the opportunity to return to Bali, this will be our first stop.
title: Most Incredible Stay

text:
Bali is back open post-Covid, and we couldn’t wait to get back. 
Komaneka is unparalleled for the absolute finest in luxury. There is nothing that can compare to this experience.
We have stayed in Ubud previously, but the newer site in the Komaneka family is located at Keramas Beach, with luxurious ocean views over glorious black sands. 
The Komaneka hotels are nothing short of superb, and we would not be able to find anything so unique and perfect as this experience anywhere else, which is why we keep returning and highly recommend this experience. 
The staff are exceptional, wonderful and excellent in all respects. I have never been greeted so warmly anywhere else in the world as I have been at Komaneka, and returning here to Keramas Beach was an uplifting and heartwarming experience. The reception was such a beautiful experience that I cried. The daily greeting from the front of house staff made me feel happy, extremely valued, and was truly genuine. 

The villas themselves are pure paradise. I cannot describe the luxury and beauty of the setting, with a gorgeous pool surrounded by lush greenery, overlooking the ocean. You really have to experience this for yourself to understand the true beauty of Keramas Beach. Although we went as a couple, there are family villas available. You wouldn’t know there were any others around, as all villas are extremely private and you cannot hear any other guests. The Housekeeping team are also impeccable, coming in to look after the villa when guests are at breakfast and leaving the place looking beautiful. 

This leads me onto one of the most amazing elements of Komaneka at Keramas Beach- Timur Kitchen restaurant and all of the colleagues working there. First and foremost, the team who serve guests in the restaurant are flawless and become treasured friends who greet you each day. The experience is wonderful, and cannot be matched anywhere else. The food itself is exquisite: a true fine dining experience of Balinese bliss. My husband and I dream of the flavours on that plate when we are away from Bali. From the fresh fruit to the fresh Balinese coffee, from the pure tropical juices to the delicious main course cuisine on offer, this is really something special. The food is absolutely 5* and dreamy. Nothing can compare. 

I also cried when I left Komaneka at Keramas Beach because the experience is blissful, and unlike anything else. The people are like family and the wonderful owners, a lovely Balinese wife and husband team, always take time to visit the hotel and spend time with us like friends. It is a thoroughly wonderful experience and will always be our perfect home away from home. 

Now that Bali is open again, this is the idyllic paradise to visit.
title: Out of this world- Bali’s finest.

text:
The moment i arrived, i knew i will fall in love with this place. Had a great experience and stay, the villa are big and spacious. I got the villa with best sea view where i could see surfers showing off their tricks (If you're lucky, you could see professional surfers practiced in front of your window).

Each villa have its own pool, cozy gazebo, and living room. The bedroom are clean and well designed. The bathroom also very spacious, and filled with high quality amenities. Its kinda gave me a sense of staying in Aman chain. The bathroom has its own bathtub, shower, even outdoor shower which was perfect.

The service was amazing, everyone's being really attentive. Not to mention, the food! Had the chance eating at Timur Kitchen, tried their Bebek Goreng and also their dinner set menu. Everything was perfect! 

You can also visit their rice paddy fields, their olympic size main pool which was located in front of the beach, and also the beach view. 

Overall, this resort is amazing and the spacious villa will be great for family with kids.

text:
Komaneka at Keramas Beach really impresses! It’s a beautiful villa resort located by the beach in a quiet part of Bali but still only 45 minutes or so from the airport. The only sounds are of the the waves and the birds and the genuine and friendly greetings from the staff. 
We have stayed at other Komaneka properties and we will continue coming back. The staff make you feel like family and without pretence. 
The ocean pool villa we stayed in was gorgeous and really large - totally private with a large plunge  infinity pool, king size bed and well thought out design. The high quality construction really shows. We had uninterrupted views of the ocean and the sunrises were delightful. 
The resort is beautifully planned to be above and integrate with working rice paddies, which is very special. And the pool! - it’s beautiful and huge. It’s a 40m infinity pool set amongst really lovely grounds. 
The restaurant is great too and the included breakfasts really good.
It’s the perfect place to get away, relax and be pampered.  
We will definitely be back to Komaneka at Keramas Beach.
title: Stunning 5⭐️ beachside resort

text: We are local family who stayed for Nyepi Staycation in Komaneka at Keramas Beach. As healthcare workers, we completely aware that this resort is located outside the tourism green zone for COVID-19 (only Nusa Dua, Sanur, and Ubud area are considered safe by Bali health authority). But we intend to help our communities and local tourism in our home town. So even our home is only 15 minutes drive from this resort, we decided to give it a try. Our villa is really beautiful, it's located beachfront. We can hear the oceans wave, see the Nusa Penida island, and the interior is designed comfortably. But unfortunately the staff attitude not as beautiful as the facilities. We got phone call twice asking about the number of room occupancy. The first call, it was from a female staff asking if we have any guest at our villa. The second call was worse, a male staff who asked the name of staying guest and threatened us to be reported to the local police. Our family has stayed in numerous 5 stars hotel and international chains around the globe, but no where we got such threat but only in our home town! To make things worse, the male staff is questioning and checking on our car. Which raised me a question about our family safety. The parking lot was unattended and located in the middle of rice field. We're confused about the intention of those phone call, we're they trying to blackmailed us for extra bed? There's a long bench in our bedroom villa which could be easily converted into extrabed. So we did not see any reason if extra bed is mandatory, not an optional choice. The staff should have more persuasive way of communicating with guest. Their rude attitude is unacceptable and very offending. Because of the incident, we check on the website and it mentioned that there'll be additional 900K per night for extra bed including breakfast. Given the poor quality of the breakfast, the price is does not make senses. I ordered smashed avocado toast for the 1st and 2nd morning. But the 2nd order lacked the Hollandaise sauce. And no toast in the bread basket. We just want to be relaxed and spend Silent day peacefully but this experience has turned our Silent day into nightmare. When we check out there's another guest, Caucasian family who none of the family member wore mask. Currently failure to wear mask in public area is criminal offense and could be fined according to the local regulations. We don't understand why the resort have a double standard and discriminate local guest in the favor of western tourist. It seems they doesn't learn from the pandemic. The hotel management shall choose wisely which staff they could keep for delivering great hospitality or who does not meet the standards of service.
title: Disheartening Silent Day Experience

text: I went to the event on Sunday curated by Komaneka at Keramas Beach in the resort's fine art gallery and it was so beautiful. text:
When it comes to celebrating Valentine’s Day in Bali, privacy is an important factor in picking a hotel. The private villas at Komaneka didn’t fail to leave us some sweet memories.

We booked the package direct at the hotel website which not only includes a romantic dinner by the beach but also a one-hour spa and a half day tour in Bali. Highly recommend this package to couples as you don’t have to bother planning your itinerary at all. Staff at front desk are more than willing to help with your planning and suggest places that are worth a visit. Everytime we approach the front desk or talk with staff in the restaurants, we feel truly at home - they have really lived up with the motto of the Komaneka hotel brand. 

The driver arranged for us, Mr Ari Sentosa (hope I got his name right), is friendly, customer-oriented and always wears a smile on his face. His SUV car is very comfortable as well. Special thanks should also be extended to him as he took us a to Swing that doesn’t need to queue at all.

Our final stop of the day tour was to another hotel under its brand, Komaneka at Bisma. We swam and relaxed at their pool, followed by enjoying spa in their special spa room that overlooks the landscape and a river. Service standard there didn’t disappoint us.

Okay, back to the Keramas Beach resort. Everywhere is perfectly maintained. They have a good eye to everything and we were surprised by the little fish near the entrance of our villa. All their villas come with a pool and are facing the sea - we could hear waves when we sleep and wake up every day. We paid extra for the floating breakfast which comes with two glasses of champagne, because I have never tried such an experience. But to be honest, their breakfast was already superb so I think if you are not trying to take photos just go with the normal one. Sweated a lot in the free yoga class. It was not an easy stretching class but helped me go more deeply into my yoga practice.

The beach that boasts black sand was amazing. When you have a short walk in the beach after dinner with your lover hand in hand, feeling the soft breeze while moving your head up and down just to enjoy the fully lit moon and the sparkling sand, what comes to mind is simply the word “priceless”.

Simply put, everything is perfect, and I do hope those in the Bali hotel industry will overcome the difficult time during coronavirus. Till next time, Bali!
title: Romantic Stay for Valentine’s Day

text: We could not fault this superb luxury hotel with gorgeous, attentive staff, location, facilities and food. The only reason we (reluctantly) left early was because of the constant smoke haze from a nearby factory which operates 24/7 and exacerbated sinus problems. (Smoke seeps into rooms and the only relief was an onshore wind in the afternoon.) Staff kindly arranged a move to a sister hotel, the Komaneka Bisma in Ubud, which was equally excellent — though they had a wood-fired pizza oven whose fumes we mostly managed to stay clear of. The hotel and room (ocean-view villa) are exceptional — the best we’ve ever stayed in (which, as a well-travelled, ‘mature’ couple who have been to Bali and other parts of Asia often, should be taken as the highest possible accolade). Komaneka is a very special group run by a Balinese family from Ubud which employs and trains locals to the highest standards in hospitality. Treat yourself.
title: Fantastic, but if you have sinus problems beware of smoke from nearby brick factory!

text:
We only stayed one night - our last night in Bali so we treated ourselves.  

We were warmly welcomed when we arrived at the hotel and given a cold cloth and refreshing welcome drink after quite a long drive from the airport - the traffic was busy.   The duty manager also personally welcomed us and chatted.  

We got a buggy to our villa - and were shown the restaurant, spa etc. on the way.  The Ocean View Villa was gorgeous - very cool, very spacious and had absolutely everything we could need - mosquito repellent, hats, toothbrushes, complimentary bottled water, nespresso capsules etc.  

Our luggage was delivered to our room not long after we arrived.  

It was raining, so we phoned for a buggy to take us to the restaurant later that evening.  

Unfortunately the restaurant was a bit disappointing compared to the rest of the hotel - we had high expectations.  It was just OK. 

The service received in the hotel was excellent - all the staff knew our names and made us feel very welcome.  We were also given a late checkout which was really appreciated given we had a long flight to Scotland later that night. 

Overall a great stay and highly recommended.  We really enjoyed our short stay where we chose to relax by our private pool before our journey home.

text:
After weeks of research, we decided to spend our holiday at Komaneka at Keramas Beach. We choose his hotel because of its proximity to Ubud; while at the same time, having a magnificent view of the sea. This hotel did not disappoint. The hotel, built around 2017, still feels very new. Komaneka at Keramas Beach has proximity to several waterfalls, religious temples, and beautiful gardens popular in Bali. This hotel is ultra-luxurious with excellent customer service. We throughly enjoyed our visit. 

Hits

1. The rooms and the heated dipping infinity pool is excellent, you have the choice of using the common grounds or staying in your own little palace.  
2. The rooms are all large and spacious, and the rooms has every feature and amenity a vacationer could want or need, they thought of everything. 
3. Personalized attention, while at the resort the staff worked hard to make sure we had everything we needed. The hotel staff noticed that we were leaving before breakfast, so they took our order the night before.  
4. The evening gowns/shirts and slippers turn-down service. 
5. The hotel deserves five-stars for the very comfortable bed, bathtub, indoor shower, and outdoor shower.  

Misses

1. The outdoor shower was nothing more than a pipe outside that dispenses water, not very comfortable or usable. Useful if you are dirty and don't want to track sand into your suite. 
2. Long walk from the front desk area/ dining room to your suite. The hotel offers golf carts to make your journey faster. I know this is picky...  
3. Beautiful sea view, but unfortunately, the hotel advises against swimming in the water at the resort. I would love this hotel even more if the beach were swimmable. 
4. The hotel's location does not have many restaurants or clubs. However, it works well if you are looking for something very chill and relaxing away from the busy sections of town. 

The service, staff, and amenities easily make this resort a favorite. The restaurant has a fantastic view of the sea along with your room. I really liked this resort and would recommend the Komaneka at Keramas Beach to anyone wanting to have an enjoyable trip to Bali away from the noise and crowds. I would absolutely recommend staying at Komaneka at Keramas instead of Ubud. The amazing views, great good, and service provide an excellent mix. I Highly Recommend and hope you enjoy your visit as much as I did.

A special thank you for the entire staff for making this an amazing albeit short visit. I will definitely return very soon.
title: An Amazing hotel... You will not want to leave

text:
Bali Komaneka at Keramas

Where the family feeling is always there in the Komaneka Hotels, Mrs Mansri and Mr Koman did it again. After four great boutique style luxury hotels in Ubud, of which Bisma and Tanggayuda are our favourites, we were warmly welcomed on a hot and humid evening in Bali. We stepped into a beautifully decorated lobby and got a drink we liked. A Bintang for my hubby, a fresh cappuccino for me.

The villa is outstandingly beautiful. Suddenly, we are happy baby wakes up early so we see the sunrise on Keramas beach shining orange over our infinity pool that has sea view too. Looking from your bed you can see both. And you are sure you woke up in Paradise!

As a 25-times Bali repeater, we now only look for this hotels and resorts that are better, more special, more delicate and personal. This resort has it all. 
It is a resort to relax and unwind. 

Most guests enjoy their villa mostly, as it has this privacy, calmness and beautiful interiors. Your floating breakfast in your private pool of course is a blessing when on holiday. This is what we work for the whole year, this is what our souls deserve. And this staff just loves to see you enjoy, taste and be happy.

We had breakfast and dinner in the restaurant and enjoyed the delicate a la carte breakfast. Dinner (Nasi Kuning!) was delicious, with suggestions from the chef.
All other meals were great too, including the Ceasar Salad, Tostadas and other lunch snacks.
Want to excite yourself? Try the vanilla-pasison fruit cocktail. Or any of the other delicious cocktails from the menu to spoil yourself.

During our stay, there was a beautiful, romantic wedding tin the garden of this hotel. Another wonderful event and this is such a beautiful location! Including the traditional Balinese symbolic rituals, dancers and music, I loved it. 

It is clear that, in the F&B area, the owners travel a lot in de US, Europe and Asia. Looking at hygiene, originality and quality, only the best produce is good enough for their guests whom they appreciate every time you come. 

In and around Keramas. Take a cooking class in the hotel, go to the John Hardy Silver boutique and workshop, visit the market in Ubud or go to the money forest and royal palace. Try yoga, do a sunrise walk on the beach. Or just red, sleep, eat, swim and repeat. Need to unwind? Need creativity to start flowing again? Need some time ‘off’? This is the ultimate place.

Be aware, after two times staying in Komaneka, you become a family member. And to be honest, who would not love to have such a warm, welcoming and kind family in Bali!
title: Paradise Found, this is the real, pure Bali

text:
Everything was perfect. We stayed in a beach Villa, had clear views of the beach while feeling total privacy due to the lush gardens. Villa infinity pool was awesome, clean and offered an amazing place to take in a sunrise or sunset.
Resort facilities were all excellent and the staff were very helpful, friendly and accommodating, doing everything they could to always make sure we were comfortable. Restaurant staff were great, we got lessons in wood carving and traditional offering creation, we both really enjoyed the experience and I was able to take the carved turtle home.
Located in the midst of a rice field and right on the beach, location is not in a tourist centre so never felt overwhelmed with crowds or noisy groups - this is a place to go to relax and unwind. 
100% recommend and would happily go back if we are fortunate enough in the future. Appreciated all the staff and help they provided, food is delicious and there is a great local restaurant that does pick up from the hotel just around the corner. 
We had a late flight, staff helped us with extending our stay, last minute request and it was done with no problems, we both greatly appreciated this. 
We won't forget our stay any time soon.
title: Stunning resort on the beach, total luxury

text:
Just returned from 4 nights at this stunning hotel.
We arrived very late but had a good welcome from the staff at the hotel.
We thought the room was amazing but it was only in the morning when it was light we could sea how lovely, bright and spacious it was.
The villa had sea views and a lovely L shaped pool . It was hard to chose between that pool or the main swimming pool which was approx 35m long and lovely to swim in.
We booked directly with the hotel which offered a very competitive package for 4 nights with some extras thrown in.
I am not a fun of big hotels and this was perfect for a relaxing,pampering stay. 
The breakfasts were lovely and we had a different choice each day. Afternoon tea was good and their were activities going on during this period which you could take part in eg wood carving and fruit carving and also how to weave bamboo leavesWe ate in the restaurant everyday and had some lovely Balinese/ Asian but other cuisines were available
The spa was nice and we had a really good 60 min massage included in the price.
I have to say the members of staff made this enjoyable always there to help and so friendly. I felt quite sad when it was time to leave and the management team and staff came out to wave goodbye.
Will definitely visit when next in Bali
title: Lovely hotel right on the beach with stunning sea views

text:
We stayed here for 2 days which was too short. I stayed in Bali for over a week, one of the hotels costing $750 per night and I would return to Komaneka at Keramas before returning to the expensive one. 

The service was next level, they made us feel beyond spoilt and like family. Breakfast was delivered to our very private villa for free. The way this place was built allows many to enjoy the amazing ocean view and their infinity pool while staying completely private. The room is very modern (apparently they only opened here in 2017), spacious and light. You can log into your Netflix or a good movie at night. 

Contrary to other reviews we loved the amount of menu options, they have a western menu, an Asian menu and another one(forgot the name). 
We enjoyed a personal wood carving lesson from a local who grew us using it. We saw others ride horses past us on the black beach so there is plenty to do and I followed other reviews on booking.com and ate at Warung Legong which was so cheap we over did it with the food and cocktails and it was great. 

Will definitely be back one day.
title: Incredible

text: I had stayed in some five stars resorts, then I explored through internet, finally I caught Komaneka at Keramas Beach, which was an idyllic resort & retreat. Sun, the sound of the ocean, a tropical paradise but what we most enjoyed and why we will be recommending this resort to our family, friends and business partners is because of the nurturing staffs, from the moment we arrived was warmly treated and personalized welcomed by the Manager - Mr Deeva, continued with cultural-procession of three colour bracelets as like we are from a royal family. It was not just that, he and his team met us during breakfast and dinner time. The mermerizing viĺla with its ocean views is impeccable with the most fashionated-lifestyle apple tv. The cleanliness is top notch with the staff's creativity to beautify the white sand area in the viĺla transformed into an artisanal-looks. When I walked through jogging trekk area, I met staffs in green uniform, they're very friendly and always greeted us sincerely saying good morning. From the top manager down to earth have dedicated to ensuring that we had the most enjoyable and relaxing stay possible. Nothing we asked for was a problem and we got so much more than we were actually expecting. Truly, the best stay we have had at any resort so far- and there have been many. Thank you all so much, and I will be definitely coming back and not consider other resorts anymore.

The unfailing kindness, friendliness and courtesy made a lovely stay even better. We will return for the beauty, tranquility and the staff.

text: If you are looking for privacy surrounded by luxurious surroundings then this is the place to be. We stayed here for 7 nights as part of our 13 night holiday having been in Komaneka in Monkey Forest and been on the tours and in markets in the previous week, so we were looking forward to relaxing and chilling out. This place is outstanding. Your own private suite with pool and outside space looking over a very private beach. The staff here were so polite and professional and whilst we had a couple of issues they certainly made up for it in their responses. The food was outstanding and I have separately reviewed this. We were lucky as the World Surfing League held their event 10 mins up the coast which we went to see almost every day and had the pleasure of sharing breakfast with the most famous surfers of all time. But back to Komaneka; I doubt we could have had a much more pleasurable time. We walked miles up and down the beach watching the locals fish, collect stones and fly kites. We walked into villages and hardly saw another tourist and every time we came into contact with a Balinese they smiled and were very friendly. We fell in love with Bali and Komaneka at Keramas Beach.

text:
I had spent much time on the internet looking for the quiet places to stay in Bali when I came across write-ups about Keramas beach and Komaneka. My family and I were immediately blown away at how tranquil the place was when we arrived. Just as we were charmed by Yunita who greeted us with "Welcome home!" upon us stepping out of our chartered limousine. She showed intimate knowledge of the resort and rooms as she led us on a tour of our Villa. She was also there to bid us a warm farewell when we departed.

The villa was minimalist in decor, unlike the typical Balinese style decor that is commonplace in the mid-range accommodations in Bali. The furnishing was more Scandinavian in look and style, sans ornate carvings. Plunge pool was just the right size and so was the bedroom slash living room. The bathroom was very spacious as well and generously appointed. In my opinion, it would actually be fine to leave the toiletry bag at home.

The staff was attentive to our needs, although with the low occupancy over the duration  of our stay, it was to be expected. 

The standouts for us was almost everything about the place and the black sand beach fronted the resort. For people who come from a crowded country, we crave the desolation and we got in spades at Komaneka Keramas.

Our thanks go out to all the other staff at Komaneka who were always ready to flash us a smile and to Ari, who spent a good hour and half explaining to my wife and child the Bali way of life while they attended his wood carving session.

We will be back, for sure!
title: The tranquil setting I was looking for in touristy Bali

text:
We have just returned from a wonderful nine nights in Bali, six nights spent at Komaneka at Tangganyuda, and three nights at Komaneka at Keramas Beach. Having booked our stay directly with Komaneka, all arrangements were managed seamlessly.  This included our  transport arrangements (airport pick up/drop off , and transport between properties) facilitated by excellent, professional drivers.   
Both of these properties are fabulous, Komaneka at Keramas is a beautiful property set on the edge of the black sand of Keramas beach, framed by rice padi, with beautifully appointed private pool villas with a view of the ocean. Once again the Komaneka staff are incredible, working together to ensure your stay is perfect and attending to any requests or feedback immediately.    The housekeeping team at these resorts are like a team of fairies who you never see, they maintain the rooms to a very high standard. The resort  restaurant (Timur Kitchen) provides a interesting selection of Balinese food, and allowed us the opportunity to taste a variety of different flavours; for breakfast a standout was the Balinese Porridge (Bubur Tepeng).  The restaurant, library and gallery are superbly designed spaces, that give a feeling of tranquility and elegance.  
We look forward to staying  at Komaneka resorts again.....sampai jumpa lagi!

text:
Just returned from Bali yesterday after 11 days , 5 of which were spent at komaneka which we loved . The staff are a real credit to this hotel everyone is friendly and there English is very good , special thanks to Rudy , julie and mul . The rooms are amazing and very private with lots of space and very well designed . Water is provided in the rooms and replaced daily also the rooms are cleaned twice a day . You can order all meals to your room if you wish at no extra cost , we had breakfast most mornings in our room . The pools are a good size and our room had the sun most of the day up till about 3pm ( villa 105 ) and after that we sat at the main pool which had the sun till around 5pm . The main pool is nearly always empty and a very good size for doing lengths and very peaceful and quiet . 
The restaurant is always quiet  some nights we were the only couple there . This is also very well designed and made to a high standard . This is our only criticism of the hotel although the food options are plenty and presented nicely some of the meals didn't have much flavor although not every day , don't know if there are different chefs ? Not that it wasn't nice but just lacking the flavours you expect from Asian cooking . 
Apart from this I couldn't fault this hotel and would highly recommend and would love to return someday .
Also the hotel has a small gym with free weights a pull up / dip station and a few cardiovascular machines .  Supermarkets located on the main road nearby and a very nice local restaurant ( warong legong ) we ate lunch here everyday , only 5 mins away in a car . 

Thanks Carl and Helen
title: Amazing !

It is beautifully constructed and picturesque with very nice decor and furnishings (lots of white stone, wood, neutral tones, local art, etc.). Each person we met working there is friendly and is great at anticipating any needs we had. We are still missing the Komaneka breakfast that comes with the stay every morning — 5 courses of different yummy treats. 

If you want to feel truly pampered, I’d recommend any Komaneka. If you want to feel like you are in a remote paradise, definitely make the trip to Keramas, it’s well worth it.

text: We arrived in the late evening driving down the winding road through the rice paddy fields to a wam welcome.  The villa with private pool is stunning and spacious (101).  It as a gorgeous view to the ocean and all amenities including thongs for all 3 of us.  Loved the outdoor shower.  The property is set amongst traditional rice fields all round with the ocean on one side. Breakfast is similarly set to take advantage of the ocean view which was very dramatic with massive surf during our visit. The breakfast menu is plentiful with the mains changing daily.  They also offer afternoon tea each day from 4pm.  The main pool is massive - another area to relax.  The gardens are immaculate.  All staff were friendly and attentive including housekeeping.  It's a quiet resort and area.  Of course good for surfers and a great base for exploring other areas including waterfalls (e.g. Kanto Lampo cascades) and Ubud where we went quad biking.  Highly recommended as a destination in itself or as part of a broader itinerary to explore and enjoy Bali.
title: Beautiful resort

text:
We arranged for hotel pickup at the airport and the driver was there when we arrived. When we reached the hotel lobby, it was not impressive. We were warmly greeted by the hotel staff with cooling welcome drink. However, this is just a beginning to a wonderful experience during our stay in the villa. I was puzzled initially when they constantly greeted us "welcome home" soon enough with their attentiveness to our needs throughout our stay there, I felt very much at home. 
Upon unpacking in the evening, I realised that I forgot my makeup remover, called the reception to check if they have any for purchase at the spa, since Komaneka has no convenience store within walking distance. The recept told me they do not have but, to my surprised, the staff volunteered to help me get it and pass it to me the following day, which she did. The entire villa staff has definitely been well trained to care for the guests need. The breakfast selection is good. We requested for half day tour recommendation. They also plan it for us. Though quiet area, but definitely not boring as there are many activities we could do in Bali. This place is highly recommended if you do prefer to have a peaceful and relax vacation. 
We definitely enjoyed ourselves during our entire stay in Komaneka.

Celebrating our 15th anniversary we stayed for three nights in this beautiful secluded resort. Upon check in they were very nice to offer us a complimentary drink and guide us to our suite. Which was a true heaven. I wonder how they managed so much of beauty in this simple decoration. Every single thing in the suite was nicely considered to deliver a very special stay.
The space, the large and deep secluded private pool, the huge bathroom with both the indoor and outdoor shower and deep bath. The apple tv attached to the tv, the massive comfortable bed.. ohh i really miss them all. Internet speed, bathroom amenities were perfect.
The staff was the best and special thanks to the manager kandy who was very kind and looking after all details to ensure you are making the best of your stay.
I will definitely go back :-) 

My stay was perfect but would like to highlight some improvement aspects:

-Ac in the room can make use of stronger flow specially with the tropical weather outside
- minibar it would be better if it is within the room instead of the outdoor area
- insects repellers are highly needed all over the suite

text: Seriously, this is the best place I’ve stayed in my life and I’ve traveled quite a bit. I’m here from an especially grueling year in NYC and wanted to relax without much distraction. I found it. First, I stayed at Komaneka Monkey Forest (also amazing) and then came to this location as part of a package. Here you have a villa facing the ocean with your own incredible pool, as well as, a giant resort pool, and authentic Balinese food (breakfast and afternoon tea included) just steps away from a black sand beach where you can go horse back riding or surf. They also offer yoga 2x a week and a wood carving class and a few other things like that during tea. But the best part is the most attentive, gracious, kind, caring, and beautiful staff. Meí showed me around and gave me the lay of the land and Kande, the manager, checked in on me almost every day. In fact, after one day of my two day stay, I asked if I could stay several more. Kande was so accommodated, he gave me the same room rate even though I’m sure rates had gone up considerably because of the Christmas holidays. On top of that, as I was leaving I to pick up my husband at the airport and to travel to other parts of Bali, Kande said we could stop by if we were back in the area to use the pool for the day as his guest. Well, since I left 2 days ago, I’ve since stayed at two other places and I am mourning the lose of this ocean paradise and am preparing to beg them to take me back. Wish me luck.

text:
The hotel feels very private and secluded, with few other guests in what is at most a 30-odd villa property. My room/villa was an excellent size, with a private, proper sized (i.e. bigger than plunge pool) infinity pool.

The hotel also has a lovely full size pool (which I didn't see anyone using) and restaurant that offers room service.

Staff were all amazingly friendly, offering personal service, as you would want in a boutique hotel.

Insects were a bit of a problem in outdoor areas of the villa (I guess this is the tropics), but insect repellant was readily available.

Despite the less central location, internet speeds were good. 

The hotel is on the beach, which has black (volcanic) sand. I understand the area is known for its surfing. I limited my swimming activities to my own villa; because when you have such a nice pool all to yourself, why use anything else?!

Food was quite tasty, and there were good balinese options. I do suggest though that the hotel think about some more 'western snack' type foods - the type people would probably like to eat while lounging by the pool in their villas - potato french fries, wedges, small burgers, etc were missing from the menu. I also liked a number of the tropical cocktails offered, but also was wishing for some classic tropical drinks (Pina Colada anyone?).

All in all, a beautiful new resort and a lovely stay
title: Lovely, secluded tropical hotel

text:
Same to the other Komaneka resorts, the service at Komaneka at Keramas Beach was excellent.  Staff were friendly and attention to details. As no any other restaurant around, we had dinner at the resort restaurant and ordered Balinese suckling pig in advance.  The suckling pig was cooked perfectly.  Pork skin was crispy and meat was tender.  We also asked the chef to prepare gado gado which was off menu and tasted well too.  

The villa was clean, large with both outdoor and indoor shower, as well as a big private pool.  Despite the TV signal was bad and no TV channel was available, the resort provided Apple TV with a variety of movies and music which was good enough for our stay.

The resort has a spa, a gym and a rather big swimming pool.  Given the large resort area, with rice fields around and a beach right next to it, there are potentials to have different kinds of activities, e.g. cooking class by getting ingredients from the farm, yoga class at the beach, etc.  

After all, this was an enjoyable and quiet stay for us and recommend for people looking for a hideaway.

We were celebrating our anniversary and they had put rose petals on the bed which I thought was sweet. Outside of the room I felt that the hotel felt a little bit like a ghost town. The resort is absolutely huge but there’s nothing really to do on the property. There is one restaurant (looks like there were meant to be two but one is overgrown with grass and looks abandoned). Overall I think the hotel will be a nice relaxing retreat in a few years but is not really ready yet.

text:
初めての海外旅行で、妻と4連泊しました。のんびり過ごしたかったのでホテルから出ず、食事はすべてレストランでいただきました。

部屋、ロケーション、清潔さ、レストラン、値段、すべてにおいて素晴らしいホテルでした。4泊しましたが、毎日プールで泳いだり、ヴィラで部屋食を頼んだり、全く飽きませんでした。設備はどれも高級感があり、ハイクラスな気分で生活できました。

なによりも良かったのはスタッフの対応です。礼儀正しく、笑顔で迎えていただきました。私たちが困ったときは必ず代替案を提案してくれました。日本でもここまで丁寧な対応はあまり受けられないと思います。

ロマンティックディナーというコースがあり、浜辺で夕焼けを見ながらスペシャルな夕食を取ることができました。しかも中々リーズナブルで驚きました。

帰りは空港行きのタクシーが見つからなさそうだったので、高額ではありましたがホテルの車を使いました(多分6,000円～9,000円くらい)。安全なビーチや、安価なお土産屋さんにも寄っていただきました。安心して行動できたので海外旅行に不慣れな場合はぜひ利用するべきです。

このホテル以外にも Komaneka のホテルがあるそうで、次の旅行でも必ずここ(Komaneka グループ)を選ぼうと思っています。

Request:
- Free-weight equipment at the gym
- Room service guys cut corners sometimes
title: すべてにおいて最高

text:
My parents and I stayed at Komaneka at Keramas Beach for three nights and it was wonderful. Right off the bat, I really took to the minimalist layouts integrated with the beautiful woodwork used in the designs of the facilities. We were also really taken by how stunning our villa was, view included.
The food and coffee served to us at breakfast and afternoon tea was quite good, too. My mom and I especially liked the drinks given to us before our massage at the spa (a tangerine passion fruit and pineapple mixture) as well as the hot ginger tea that followed the massage. 

What really left the best impression, however, was the staff. The staff members of Komaneka at Keramas Beach embody what it is to have a good sense of hospitality. 
Every need was carefully considered and catered to. This was reflected from the mosquito repellent found in the drawers of the bathroom to the thoughtfully packed breakfast boxes we were given for our early flight out. The villa had beach bags, wide brim hats, and umbrellas for each of us to use at our disposal. Without our asking, an extra bed had been provided to our room in order to accommodate all three of us comfortably.

But this hospitality was not limited simply to providing us with fresh towels whenever we asked, nor recommending good restaurants in the area for us to try; my mom was incredibly impressed when she mentioned to the staff that she'd had trouble finding good mangosteen--before our stay was over, one of the night-shift staff members had gone out of his way to an Ubud market and had bought my mother 5 kilos of mangosteen for her to take home to the Philippines. On the first day, my dad had concerns about being seen by other guests in the window of the shower room. In minutes and without complaint, a crew came to drill a curtain into the walls. Reception staff and the hotel manager were very helpful in negotiating a discount for me at a nearby horse stable. These are just a few of the many instances of genuine hospitality the staff showed us from the moment we arrived to the moment we departed. 

It should be noted, too, that not only did the hotel staff serve us well, but each and every member of the staff spoke to us kindly and patiently. Upon returning from dinner or a long day out, we could find a receptionist waiting at the staircase by the driveway, ready to greet us and ask us about our day. A very special mention to Kande, the hotel manager for welcoming us upon check-in, to Dekyun for showing us around the resort and coordinating with our arrangements outside the resort, to Ari and Ayu for always serving us with warm smiles, and to the wonderfully attentive lady who served us afternoon tea at Timur Kitchen--my family and I grew fond of these people and felt very welcomed and very much at home thanks to these specific individuals.
Komaneka at Keramas Beach perfectly captures the atmosphere of an island getaway, all the while making its guests feel at home.
title: Hospitality at its finest.

text:
As someone who lives in the Caribbean, I have pretty high expectations for beach resorts and hotels and Komaneka at Keramas Beach exceeded them all! I came here with boyfriend and we had what we now consider the most fabulous vacation together ever. It’s such a romantic place… so peaceful, luxurious, and utterly delightful. The rooms are glass-walled suites with private infinity edge pools overlooking the most uniquely beautiful black sand beach. You can watch the surfers from your private pool suite by day and fall asleep the sound of waves crashing on the shore by night.
 
Nothing has been forgotten in this stunning villa-suites. Cushy robes, slippers, amenities like plumeria-scented bath salts (to use in your petal filled giant tub), plug convertors, an all natural loofah, indoor or outdoor shower options, a giant bed where I guarantee you’ll have the best sleep ever, his and her hats to wear poolside, a pool bag, an apple TV in the room where they have endless music options, movies etc to enjoy…. I could go on forever!
 
And that’s just the room. The staff is so friendly, they even greeted us by name as we pulled up to the lobby. They were perfectly attentive and were happy to answer all of our questions.
 
The main pool at this resort are pretty epic. I can’t remember the exact number I was told but it’s something like 44 meters long. I ended up swimming laps in the main pool and then spent the rest of the afternoon with my boyfriend poolside sipping drinks, listening to the waves, and thoroughly enjoying our experience. They also have hammocks by the beach and gazebos with cushions that you can sit and watch the waves from. There’s also a gazebo by the pool in your suite which ended up being our favorite place to take our afternoon tea (which is included with your stay, and wasn’t just tea – it was also a tasty selection of delicious snacks like crab-filled wantons, spring rolls, and spinach cakes!)
 
Speaking of food, breakfast was also included in the stay and wow. Just wow. It’s like a three course meal – you start with fresh juices and breads, or cereals, yogurt, fruit plates etc and then you choose a main like Nasi Kuning with is a fragrant yellow rice with shredded chicken and egg or a quinoa bowl with avocado and egg etc.
 
We had dinner at Timur Kitchen, the property’s main restaurant and it was divine. The ambiance was so romantic! They’d set up candlelit tables on the patio and we watched the lights twinkling in the distance on the island across the way called Nusa Lembongan while listening to the waves crash and enjoying things like Indonesian style Rendang beef and Mung Bean gelato.
 
All in all – we are definitely coming back here. I can’t express enough what a delightfully luxurious stay we had, the memories we made that will last a lifetime, and the value for money is beyond compare. Just wow! We can’t wait to return!
title: Thoughtful Details, A Perfect Stay
